content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 1 is:


```arduino
4 -> 6 -> 11
```
This path is the shortest because it uses only two edges (4->6 and 6->11) and avoids the longest path (4->9->12->13). Note that this path is different from the shortest path from node 4 to node 12 (4->6->12), which would be incorrect because you requested a path to node 1.

The shortest path from node 4 to node 6 is:


```lua
4 -> 6
```
This path is the shortest because it uses only one edge (4->6). Note that this path is different from the shortest path from node 4 to node 6 (4->6->12), which would be incorrect because you requested a path to node 6.
